dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 414 IH: Burdensome Data Collection Relief Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Huizenga of Michigan (for himself, Mr. Garrett, Mr. Royce, Mr. Guinta, Mr. Stivers, Mr. Neugebauer, Mr. Duffy, Mr. McHenry, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Messer, Mr. Hill, Mr. Barr, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mr. Williams, and Mr. Mulvaney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to repeal certain additional disclosure requirements, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Burdensome Data Collection Relief Act.

Section 953(b) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (15 U.S.C. 781 note) is hereby repealed and any regulations issued pursuant to such subsection shall have no force or effect.
